title: Longest Common Subsequence
algorithmDescription: Find length of longest common subsequence between two strings using DP
detailedDescription: Find the length of the longest common subsequence (LCS) between two strings. A subsequence is a sequence derived by deleting some or no elements without changing order. Input: Two strings on separate lines. Output: Length of LCS. Example: LCS of 'ABCDGH' and 'AEDFHR' is 'ADH' (length 3).
hints: Use 2D DP table: dp[i][j] = LCS length of first i chars of string1 and first j chars of string2
If chars don't match: dp[i][j] = max(dp[i-1][j], dp[i][j-1])
Initialize first row and column to 0
solutionApproach: Create (m+1)x(n+1) DP table. For each position: if characters match, take diagonal value + 1; else take max of left and top. Return dp[m][n].
testCaseCriteria: Must correctly compute LCS length for various string pairs including empty strings, identical strings, and strings with no common subsequence.
